fields.internal_notes:
No specific CFR citations; added section related to post-eligibility treatment of income. Metadata page: https://www.hhs.gov/guidance/document/1997ara-memopeti-calculation-veterans-pensions -BG

This ARA memo covers post-eligibility treatment of income for veterans in "state operated veterans' homes" for veterans without dependents in 17 states in 1997. The rule is specific to how veterans pensions should be treated as part of cost-sharing for care/spend down.  Recommend NOT approving until reviewing w/CMCS staff  for the following reasons: The $90 allowance referred to was pre-ACA and unclear if this ARA correctly reflects today's cost-sharing determination, which applied only to specific veterans in 17 states who have pensions and live in state operated veterans home that are medicaid providers.  The BBA 8015 section sunset in 2002 per the memo.

ARA memo allows states to decide how to count household size for Medicare beneficiaries who apply for QMB/SLMB so that Medicaid covers their part B premiums. Memo applies to whose income counts. Added sections cited in letter. Metadata page: https://www.hhs.gov/guidance/document/1992ara-memoeffective-date-updated-poverty-levels -BG;

SA: Initial approval to post ARA based on content alone; recommend verifying with CMCS if this was superceded by more current rules.  Memo covers  multiple topics related to when states update the annual FPL for Medicaid eligibility , including how states should stipulate date in SPA; how to determine eligibility for certain populations that would be ineligible if effective date is after  SSA COLA adjustments that occur in January (commonly known as ineligibility due to Pickle).
